intro: Hapalochilus kusaiensis, commonly known as the Kusai mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at elevations ranging from 3,000 to 5,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Hapalochilus kusaiensis is often found in alpine meadows and is a subject of interest for botanists studying high-altitude flora.
